backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor defining the hospital management system with types for doctors, emergency cases, and user profiles, plus CRUD operations gated by role-based access control (admin, doctor, patient).
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping implemented features (replacing fabricated stats with aspirational copy, comprehensive UI polish) to their affected frontend files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON dictionary of short summaries for every frontend source file, describing the purpose and key details of each component, hook, and style file in the project.
frontend/index.css: Root Tailwind CSS entry point defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for the light and dark color themes used throughout the app.
frontend/index.html: HTML shell for the Vite/React app, setting the page title to 'Vitals AI', linking the PWA manifest, and mounting the React root.
frontend/public/manifest.json: PWA manifest for Vitals AI specifying app name, theme color, standalone display mode, and a 128Ã—128 icon.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that configures TanStack Router with all six routes (/, /select-role, /portal-selection, /patient, /doctor, /admin), wraps the app in QueryClient and ThemeProvider, and renders a shared Layout with Header, Footer, and SupportButton.
frontend/src/components/AccessDeniedScre: Empty file placeholder for the AccessDeniedScreen component.
frontend/src/components/AdminDashboard.t: Admin dashboard component displaying real-time stat cards (total/available doctors, open/critical cases) via React Query and tabbed Doctor Management and Case Management panels, with an optional readOnly prop.
frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx: Empty file placeholder for the AdminPanel component.
frontend/src/components/AdminPortal.tsx: Renders an admin login form with passcode authentication (stored in sessionStorage) and, upon success, displays the AdminDashboard in read-only mode with a logout option.
frontend/src/components/CaseManagement.t: Displays a list of emergency cases with severity/status badges, allowing doctors to assign available doctors to cases or resolve them, with optional department filtering and read-only mode.
frontend/src/components/DeploymentManage: Empty file with no content or exports.
frontend/src/components/DoctorManagement: Provides a form to register new doctors (with a registration code gate) and lists all doctors with their availability status, allowing toggling of availability unless in read-only mode.
frontend/src/components/DoctorPortal.tsx: Implements a doctor-facing portal with login and registration tabs; once authenticated, shows the doctor's availability toggle and a filtered CaseManagement view for their department.
frontend/src/components/EmergencySOS.tsx: Empty file with no content or exports.
Empty file with no content or exports.
frontend/src/components/FaucetManagement: Empty file with no content or exports.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Renders the site-wide footer with a mission CTA banner, department list, portal navigation links, core values, and contact/branding information.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Fixed top navigation header with a teal info bar showing emergency contact info, a scrollable main nav with links, and a mobile hamburger menu. Handles smooth scrolling to page sections and navigation via TanStack Router.
frontend/src/components/HomePage.tsx: Full marketing homepage composed of multiple sections (Hero, Services, Doctors, etc.) using real doctor data from an API query. Includes department label/color helpers and animated UI elements.
frontend/src/components/LandingPage.tsx: Public-facing landing page with a hero section, feature highlights, and a 3-step onboarding flow. Directs unauthenticated users to the role selection page.
frontend/src/components/PatientPortal.ts: Patient portal with a registration form, SOS emergency case submission, and an embedded SymptomChecker tab. Uses React Query mutations to create emergency cases via the backend API.
frontend/src/components/RoleSelector.tsx: Role selection screen rendering three styled cards (Patient, Doctor, Admin) that navigate to their respective portals. Each card displays a feature list, gradient header, and a call-to-action button.
frontend/src/components/SupportButton.ts: Floating support button fixed to the bottom-right corner that toggles a popover with a mailto link to the support email. Closes automatically when clicking outside.
frontend/src/components/SymptomChecker.t: A React component that accepts symptom text input and matches it against a rule-based keyword list to suggest medications, dosages, and notes for common conditions.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: A React hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor using React Query, supporting both anonymous and authenticated (Internet Identity) usage, and invalidates dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an InternetIdentityProvider and useInternetIdentity hook for managing DFINITY Internet Identity authentication, including login, logout, and identity persistence via AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Centralizes all React Query hooks (queries and mutations) for interacting with the ICP backend actor, covering user profiles, doctors, cases, and error message formatting.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports fonts, configures Tailwind CSS, defines CSS custom properties for light/dark themes using OKLCH colors, and declares utility animation keyframes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the React app wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility module providing functions to read, persist, and clear URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routes, with sessionStorage fallback for sensitive values like admin tokens.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining dark mode, custom fonts (Inter, Plus Jakarta Sans, JetBrains Mono), an extended color palette (teal, emerald, cyan in oklch), custom border radii, and box shadows for a premium hospital UI.
project_state.json: Project state tracking file (schema v1.0.0, version 3) describing a premium hospital website with aspirational messaging, listing architectural notes, image requirements, and implemented features such as replacing fabricated statistics and performing a comprehensive UI polish pass.
